stimulusHtml: A variable voltage source is connected to an inductor of inductance L. The voltage V as a function of time t is given by the equation V(t) = βt2 , where β is a constant in units of V/s2. The current in the inductor at time t = 0 is zero. Which of the following equations gives the magnitude of the current in the inductor as a function of time?
choicesHtml: I( t )= 2β L t MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EFE@

I( t )= β L t 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F4A@

I ( t ) = β 3 L t 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4008@

I ( t ) = β L t 2 sin ( ω t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@469A@
